title: Linux telnet Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the telnet command in Linux, learn its purpose, syntax, and practical examples for troubleshooting network connectivity and remote server access.

meta.title: Linux telnet Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the telnet command in Linux, learn its purpose, syntax, and practical examples for troubleshooting network connectivity and remote server access.
meta.keywords: telnet, Linux, network, connectivity, remote server, troubleshoot

steps.title: Understand the Purpose and Syntax of the telnet Command

verify.name: Verify the telnet command usage
verify.hint: The telnet command usage information should include the text "Open a terminal to a remote host".

steps.title: Connect to a Remote Server Using the telnet Command

verify.name: Verify the telnet connection to a remote server
verify.hint: The telnet command should successfully connect to the www.example.com server on port 80.

steps.title: Troubleshoot Network Connectivity with the telnet Command

verify.name: Verify the telnet connection to a non-existent port
verify.hint: The telnet command should fail to connect to the non-existent port 8080 on www.example.com, and display the "Connection refused" message.

verify.name: Verify the telnet connection to a non-existent host
verify.hint: The telnet command should fail to connect to the non-existent host, and display the "No route to host" message.
